article_title: UnitedHealthcare Targets Medicare Advantage Overpay Policy
article_text:
UnitedHealthcare Targets Medicare Advantage Overpay Policy

Law360, New York (February 1, 2016, 7:43 PM ET) -- UnitedHealthcare has launched a suit in D.C. federal court aiming to block government policies on the return of Medicare Advantage overpayments, arguing they unfairly hold private insurance plans to stricter audit standards than traditional Medicare.



United, the nation’s largest seller of private Medicare policies, argued in its complaint on Friday that regulators have unlawfully implemented an Affordable Care Act requirement for Medicare Advantage plans to return overpayments within 60 days of identifying them.



Much of the complaint accused the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services of...
